transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1269 a and today's date is May
2nd 2017 and the title of the episode is
as the date of the economic collapse
just been leaked let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now as
we know up in Toronto Vancouver
there are huge real estate bubbles that
are getting ready to pump and we also
understand at home Capital Group well we
know they are in big trouble we know
that there's a lot of money leaving this
Bank and people are taking their money
out of the system and what we're seeing
right now is that this might spread to
another Canadian mortgage lender and
again these things are never isolated
even though they continually tell us
that these things are isolated it never
seems to be isolated in one area it
seems that something is always connected
to someplace else and so on and so on
and before you know it there are many
different mortgage lender banks that are
affected by what is happening right now
and red flags were being waved and they
were very worried about the possible
contagion hitting Canadians equitable
group this is another alternative
mortgage lender and it starts started to
see an elevated but manageable decrease
in deposit balances now the company said
that the customers have withdrawn an
average of 75 million each day between
Wednesday and Friday and when we look at
this situation we need to understand
that this is how it all begins now they
might be able to stop this they we know
there's a bailout we know that other
things are happening right now and they
might contain this for a short period of
time but as we know these things never
stay contained we also know there's a
housing bubble in Toronto Vancouver
throughout the United States and in
other areas around the world and we know
once one pops well it's going
to spread rapidly throughout each
country and we've seen this before this
is nothing new and we can see that we
all need to understand and realize that
this whole thing can go at any moment
now in Greece it looks like Greece made
a deal with their lenders and they
promised even more austerity now Athens
promised to cut pensions in 2019 and we
know that it always comes back to the
people and we know what the central
banks want they want the real assets of
the country so what did Greece promise
well they promised more austerity they
also promised to sell coal-fired plants
and coal mines equal to about 40% of its
dominant power utility Public Power Corp
capacity so basically the central
bankers have come in and they're buying
real assets from the country on pennies
on the dollar and we can see right now
that the people might not just be
sitting down for this they might
eventually give when you push them far
enough against the wall and you keep
pushing them and pushing them and
pushing them and taking things away
eventually there is a revolt and the
Greek people they've been hit hard over
the many many years and with more
austerity imposed on them on them well
the current government they should be
worried because we don't know what's
going to happen because as we can see
everything the central bankers have done
for Greece has not helped at all this
has been going on for years and years
and years like seven years now actually
longer about eight to nine years and
every time they tell us it's better they
need more austerity they need to sell
more assets off from the country and it
just gets worse for the people not
better here in the United States well we
see something happening in the subprime
market of the auto industry
and we know that stocks have never been
more overvalued than they are today
and we see that something is lurking in
the subprime auto lending arena auto
loan generation has gone absolutely
vertical since 2009 rising an incredible
56 percent in seven years even more
incredibly roughly one third of those
loans their subprime their garbage so in
the simplest terms
this is subprime 2.0 and the fuse well
it has been lit there is a one point two
trillion debt bomb here and we've been
watching this for quite a while and we
can see that there's going to be major
problems now we just got a red flag to
tell us that something has gone wrong
because auto sales
they have peaked and are now rolling
over so when we look at this we can see
that we're starting to see a repeat of
what happened in late 2007 right before
the economy fell off a cliff and the
stock market crashed
so which what it means is is that
they're not going to be able to lend
much more out there and this is the
signal that we've been looking for when
auto sales rollover it shows that
consumer is tapped out so the fact that
this is happening at a time when auto
lenders are making subprime loans and
people aren't buying even when the offer
is ridiculous and they're giving all
these incentives means this industry has
turned it's now just a matter of months
before the defaults start hitting and
we're already starting to see the
delinquencies and when were when we're
looking at this we see there's about a
hundred and twenty billion in garbage
loans out there and this could very well
be the needle that burst a Fed fueled
sixty trillion dollar debt bubble and we
need to watch this very carefully
because this could all come down with a
snap of a finger
now JPMorgan Chase they are out there
saying that they are seeing different
red flags
and this is why they're starting to sell
their stocks and what we're seeing is
that the retail investor is stepping in
and they are buying stocks like crazy
the insiders they are selling the stocks
like crazy this is a scenario that there
is a huge bubble going on right now and
this is the top of the bubble and this
is how it all ends
because once the insiders finish selling
what they need to sell that's when they
crash the system and JP Morgan is saying
the risk reward is worsening so they're
looking at the Citigroup economic
surprise index and they're saying that
has rolled over sharply now the
Citigroup economic surprises in Dex
rolled over sharply recently and is now
in the negative territory and the other
times they've seen this this is when
we've gone into a recession they see the
impact of the Chinese stimulus well that
is fading this is seen in the sharp
decline in new project starts seasonals
are now turning negative April was
typically the best month in Europe but
from May onwards the returns tended to
be poor summer seasonality was typically
negative equities posted below average
negative returns on most occasions
during the May September period
commodity prices right now are weaker
which hurts the reflation trade
inflation forwards have rolled over
Chinese PPI is likely peaking and Italy
could be the next curveball so they're
getting out of stocks because they're
very very worried with what is coming
and normally these insiders they know
exactly what is happening now Trump is
preparing to replace the top banking
regulator and yesterday you have to
remember he basically blurted out you
know maybe we should break up the big
banks and he was referring to
glass-steagall and we have to remember
glass-steagall really kept the banks
separated from risky investments from
the people's deposits and we can see
right now that he wants to go back to
that type of model and actually break up
the big
that are manipulating along with the
central bank everything that we see in
the economy right now and his first move
is to get a new banking regulator now
who is he going to pick we don't know as
of yet but he's looking at maybe mr.
Norika and he basically volunteered his
time when he was on the Trump when he
was on Trump's transition team and he
worked as the treasurer at that point in
time so there are rumors about that but
we don't know where he's going with this
as of yet now Trump blurted out
something else today where he said we
need a good shutdown in September to fix
this mess now what's very interesting
about all of this and all these
different things that he's saying right
now where he's saying that maybe we
should break up the banking system he
has Andrew Jackson hanging on the wall
inside the Oval Office where he broke up
the central banking system we also
understand that he is trying to bring
down the economy where he wants more
spending he wants to blow up more of
these bubbles so he's able to bring the
system down to show everyone that under
this system that we have right now it
cannot last if you notice when he first
came into the White House he started to
cut things and he started to uh you know
work the budget a little bit and then
all of a sudden he just stopped and he
basically went in a completely different
direction and then he started out with
all these different reviews review of
the land where Obama Bush Clinton put
the land as collateral for the debt that
we have right now he started to review
the federal overreach into education and
he started to sign different executive
orders dismantling a lot of the things
that Obama has done and there's just so
many things you can do with with an
executive order and all of this
everything that he's been doing right
now all these reviews and all these
different executive orders this is in
preparation for the collapse
the system and the question is is he
trying to tell everyone that listen
during this timeframe September October
this is when most likely the system will
come down do I know this for sure no we
know that they approved a spending
budgetary bill that will bring the
entire government to October 1st and
allow the government to stay open during
this period of time allow them to spend
another trillion dollars which most
likely they're gonna have to borrow from
the Federal Reserve which then they're
going to have to raise the debt ceiling
so the whole thing ties in to each other
and we can see that he is absolutely
getting ready and preparing for this
system to come down remember when he was
campaigning he knew that this entire
economy was in a bubble he said it many
times once he was inaugurated and he was
in office
he came out and said the economy is a
complete mess in his mind maybe he
thought he could fix it but with the
corruption and everything that's going
on in government there's no way that you
can fix something that has been built up
since 1913 it's completely impossible
and with his companies and we know that
he's had many different defaults he
realizes how to create the default how
to push it to the next level so you're
forced to default and he understands how
to restructure he understands how to put
things right now is that does that mean
it's going to be easy does that mean
we're going to wake up and the whole
system is going to come down and
everything's going to be back to normal
no basically what that means is that the
crash of the system the destruction of
the dollar the destruction of the world
the way we know it well that's going to
come to an end the hard part is going to
be rebuilding it and to rebuild it
well jobs have to come back
manufacturing has to come back the
system has to be based on a sound money
system and every
one has to abide by it can't have the
central bank just creating currency out
of thin air and this is why I really do
believe when he starts talking about
breaking up the bank's reinstating
glass-steagall having reviews of all the
land where all the minerals and also
having the drilling of oil offshore and
within the United States he realizes
that the United States well it's going
to have to depend on itself it will not
be able to depend on the rest of the
world to give products to give oil to
give everything here to the United
States it's not going to work this is
how it worked in the past where we moved
dollars out to other countries and they
returned products and services to United
States well this can't be any more so
the United States and the people here in
the United States well we're going to
have to be able to sustain ourselves by
ourselves and what are we going to need
to do this we're going to need our own
oil we're going to need gold silver
other minerals in this land because
we're not going to have dollars to send
overseas we won't be the reserve
currency anymore this is going to end
and everyone's going to have to
basically fend for themselves
there'll be no government handouts I
mean this is how it was when the country
first started actually going through the
20s 30s to 40s many people how to do it
on their own there were no real
government handouts there were a few but
we all had to do things to make to get
by there was no one to depend on there
was no government and when we go through
this crash you will not be able to
depend on the government the government
will be struggling at this point the
government is going to shrink like
you've never seen before
most of the people that work for the
government they're not going to have
jobs and this is going to be a disaster
this is not going to be easy for
everyone and we rather have this type of
collapse
then a collapse with a war yes most
likely people will die during this
period of time during the Great
Depression people did die but with a war
that might go nuclear you're talking
about millions and millions more people
dying and I believe this is why he's
trying to strategize to stop the war
just have the collapse and we're all
going to have to get through this
together so get prepared get ready for
what is coming
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
you
